summary: The Modern Employment Reform, Improvement, and Transformation Act of 2025 (MERIT Act) amends Title 5 of the United States Code, focusing on federal employee performance and conduct. Key provisions include repealing performance-based actions under Chapter 43, streamlining adverse action procedures based on performance or misconduct, modifying furlough procedures, and addressing issues related to senior executive service employees. Key changes involve how agencies address employee misconduct, setting timelines for disciplinary actions, and modifying appeal processes. It also includes the length of probationary periods and clawbacks for bonuses.
